title: On a Theorem by Ekeland-Hofer
summary:
In [EH89, Theorem 1] Ekeland-Hofer prove that for a centrally symmetric,
restricted contact type hypersurface in R^{2n} and for any global, centrally
symmetric Hamiltonian perturbation there exists a leaf-wise intersection point.
In this note we show that if we replace restricted contact type by star-shaped
there exists infinitely many leaf-wise intersection points or a leaf-wise
intersection point on a closed characteristic.

ON A THEOREM BY EKELAND-HOFER

arXiv:1001.3386v2 [math.SG] 27 Apr 2010

PETER ALBERS AND URS FRAUENFELDER
Abstract. In [EH89, Theorem 1] Ekeland-Hofer prove that for a centrally symmetric, restricted contact type hypersurface in R2n and for any global, centrally symmetric Hamiltonian perturbation there exists a leaf-wise intersection point. In this note we show that
if we replace restricted contact type by star-shaped there exists infinitely many leaf-wise
intersection points or a leaf-wise intersection point on a closed characteristic.

Theorem 1.2. Assume that S ⊂ R2n is a connected, compact, Z/2-invariant, star-shaped
hypersurface. Let t → ψt be an isotopy of the identity in Dω,Z/2 . Then there exist infinitely
many leaf-wise intersection points on S or there exists a leaf-wise intersection point y such
that the leaf LS (y) is closed, that is, LS (y) is a closed characteristic.
